description: From Middle French exclamer, from Latin exclāmō, exclāmāre (“call out”), from ex- + clāmō (“to call”).

examples: Oh fortune, thou’rt not worth my least exclame [...].

verbs.description: exclaim (third-person singular simple present exclaims, present participle exclaiming, simple past and past participle exclaimed)

entries.meaning: (intransitive) To cry out suddenly, from some strong emotion.
examples: […]  he could remember Sally tearing off a rose, stopping to exclaim at the beauty of the cabbage leaves in the moonlight  […]

entries.meaning: (transitive) To say suddenly and with strong emotion.
examples: Must she be forc’d, t’exclaime th’iniurious wrong?
Offred by him, whom she hath lou’d so long?
Nay, I will tell, and I durst almost sweare,
Edward will blush, when he his fault shall heare.
